SlideScape: The Art of Presentation

Test your creativity, presentation skills, and ability to communicate effectively through an engaging PowerPoint presentation.

About the Event

  • The PPT Making Event is designed to test participants' creativity, presentation skills, and ability to communicate effectively through slides.
  • Participants will be given an on-spot theme and will have a set amount of time to create a professional and visually engaging PowerPoint presentation.

Event Details

  • Event Type: Team of two members. Only two teams are allowed per college.
  • Theme: Each team will pick one of three themes upon arrival at the venue.
  • Evaluation: One team will be selected from each theme, and the team with the highest score among the selected teams will be declared the winner.
  • Time Allotted:
    • Preparation Time: 45 minutes to 1 hour (for creating the PPT)
    • Presentation Time: 5–10 minutes per participant/team
  • Platform: Microsoft PowerPoint (There will be no internet access during the event.)

Rules and Regulations

  • Adherence to Theme: Participants must stick closely to the theme provided on the spot. Themes will be assigned by a picking process upon arrival at the venue.
  • Slide Limit: Presentations should be limited to 5–10 slides.
  • Originality: Content must be original or sourced from royalty-free sites. Plagiarism will result in disqualification.
  • Time Management: Participants must adhere to the specified preparation and presentation times.
  • Structure: Presentations should follow a logical structure, including Title Slide, Introduction, Content, and Conclusion.

Judging Criteria

  • Creativity & Design: Engaging and attractive layout and visuals.
  • Content Relevance: Accuracy and alignment with the theme.
  • Clarity & Organization: Logical structure and flow.
  • Presentation Skills: Confidence and clarity in delivery.
  • Adherence to Guidelines: Compliance with slide limits and timing.
